items.synopsis: A number of senior Tasmanian public servants are named by an Independent MP under parliamentary privilege as people who may be facing misconduct notices over the way reports of child sexual abuse were handled.

image.altText: Three Tasmania JackJumpers basketball team players in Indigenous design uniform.

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: People crowd around a huge crater in a decimated urban area.

items.synopsis: A Gaza hospital director says more than 50 Palestinians are dead and 150 wounded after Israeli air strikes on the densely populated Jabalia refugee camp.

title.children: Israel says strikes on refugee camp killed senior Hamas leader, Palestinian officials say 50 people dead

image.altText: Israeli forces' flares light up the night sky in northern Gaza Strip

items.synopsis: Hamas's tunnels under Gaza are a prime target for Israel as it expands its ground offensive in the north of the enclave after three weeks of aerial bombardment.

title.children: Ground-level clashes intensify as Israeli military confirms deadly strikes on Gaza refugee camp

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: In an update, Israel's military spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari confirmed Tuesday's air strikes on Jabalia refugee camp and said it targeted "central Hamas stronghold." Officials at Gaza's Indonesian Hospital said more than 50 Palestinians had been killed and 150 wounded when tons of aerial explosives struck residential dwellings in the heart of the Jabalia camp in urbanised north Gaza. "During the afternoon hours, infantry and armored forces secured a central Hamas stronghold in the west part of Jabalia," Hagari said. "This stronghold served as a training center for the October 7th massacre and as a passage to the coastline from where additional terrorists set off to perpetrate the October 7th massacre. "In the course of the fighting, we eliminated many terrorists and destroyed terror infrastructure. "This is complicated combat, some of which is face-to-face combat. During the combat, we lost soldiers." The Israel military has accused Hamas, which rules the narrow coastal territory, of using civilian buildings as cover for fighters, commanders and weaponry, accusations it denies. Jabalia houses families of refugees from wars with Israel dating back to 1948. Reporting with Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel army says 'secured a central Hamas stronghold' in Gaza refugee camp air strike

children.content: In an update, Israel's military spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari confirmed Tuesday's air strikes on Jabalia refugee camp and said it targeted "central Hamas stronghold."

Officials at Gaza's Indonesian Hospital said more than 50 Palestinians had been killed and 150 wounded when tons of aerial explosives struck residential dwellings in the heart of the Jabalia camp in urbanised north Gaza.
"During the afternoon hours, infantry and armored forces secured a central Hamas stronghold in the west part of Jabalia," Hagari said.
"This stronghold served as a training center for the October 7th massacre and as a passage to the coastline from where additional terrorists set off to perpetrate the October 7th massacre.
"In the course of the fighting, we eliminated many terrorists and destroyed terror infrastructure.
"This is complicated combat, some of which is face-to-face combat. During the combat, we lost soldiers."
The Israel military has accused Hamas, which rules the narrow coastal territory, of using civilian buildings as cover for fighters, commanders and weaponry, accusations it denies.
Jabalia houses families of refugees from wars with Israel dating back to 1948.
Reporting with Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says he’s “deeply alarmed” at the intensifying conflict in Gaza and escalating civilian casualties. In a statement on Tuesday he singled out “the expansion of ground operations by the Israel Defense Forces accompanied by intense air strikes, and the continued rocket fire towards Israel from Gaza”. He expressed deep concern at the risk of a “dangerous escalation” beyond Gaza and called the level of aid getting into the Palestinian territory “completely inadequate.” Guterres said civilians "have borne the brunt of the current fighting from the outset." He again condemned "the acts of terror perpetrated by Hamas" against Israel on October 7, and the killing of civilians in Gaza, saying he is "dismayed by reports that two-thirds of those who have been killed are women and children." He said the rules of international humanitarian law "cannot be ignored." "It is not an a la carte menu and cannot be applied selectively," he said. "All parties must abide by it, including the principles of distinction, proportionality and precaution." He reiterated his call for an immediate humanitarian cease-fire and for unimpeded humanitarian access to Gaza. AP
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: UN chief 'deeply alarmed' by intensifying conflict

children.content: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says he’s “deeply alarmed” at the intensifying conflict in Gaza and escalating civilian casualties.
In a statement on Tuesday he singled out “the expansion of ground operations by the Israel Defense Forces accompanied by intense air strikes, and the continued rocket fire towards Israel from Gaza”.
He expressed deep concern at the risk of a “dangerous escalation” beyond Gaza and called the level of aid getting into the Palestinian territory “completely inadequate.”
Guterres said civilians "have borne the brunt of the current fighting from the outset."

He again condemned "the acts of terror perpetrated by Hamas" against Israel on October 7, and the killing of civilians in Gaza, saying he is "dismayed by reports that two-thirds of those who have been killed are women and children."
He said the rules of international humanitarian law "cannot be ignored."
"It is not an a la carte menu and cannot be applied selectively," he said.
"All parties must abide by it, including the principles of distinction, proportionality and precaution."
He reiterated his call for an immediate humanitarian cease-fire and for unimpeded humanitarian access to Gaza.
AP

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Hamas's tunnels under Gaza are a prime objective for Israel as it expands its ground offensive into the north of the enclave. Some of the 240 hostages that Israel says were seized by Hamas are believed to be held in the vast tunnel complex, compounding the difficulty of fighting in an urban setting. "Over the last day, combined IDF struck approximately 300 targets, including anti-tank missile and rocket launch posts below shafts, as well as military compounds inside underground tunnels belonging to the Hamas terrorist organisation," an Israeli military statement said. Militants responded with anti-tank missiles and machine gun fire, the IDF said, claiming an unspecified number of militants were killed. Hamas said in a statement its fighters were engaging in fierce battles with Israeli ground forces, who were taking losses. "The occupation is pushing its soldiers into proud Gaza, which will always be the cemetery of invaders," Hamas said. Reporting with Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Ground-level clashes intensify as Israel expands ground offensive

props.alt: Israeli forces' flares light up the night sky in northern Gaza Strip

children.content: Israeli forces' flares light up the night sky in northern Gaza Strip.
(AP: Abed Khaled)
Hamas's tunnels under Gaza are a prime objective for Israel as it expands its ground offensive into the north of the enclave.
Some of the 240 hostages that Israel says were seized by Hamas are believed to be held in the vast tunnel complex, compounding the difficulty of fighting in an urban setting.

"Over the last day, combined IDF struck approximately 300 targets, including anti-tank missile and rocket launch posts below shafts, as well as military compounds inside underground tunnels belonging to the Hamas terrorist organisation," an Israeli military statement said.
Militants responded with anti-tank missiles and machine gun fire, the IDF said, claiming an unspecified number of militants were killed.
Hamas said in a statement its fighters were engaging in fierce battles with Israeli ground forces, who were taking losses.
"The occupation is pushing its soldiers into proud Gaza, which will always be the cemetery of invaders," Hamas said.
Reporting with Reuters
